global_context.thesis: F&G neutral (49). Bull regime intact. V10.2 tightened entries to panic-only (F&G<12-15). No signals until fear deepens. Star performers (XLK, XLV, XLU, INDA) get priority allocation. Energy/SLV/IEF removed or heavily penalized.
key_risks: Tighter fear thresholds (12-15) may reduce signal frequency — monitor for missed entries
SLV/IEF removed from universe — no coverage if they become opportunities
XLE 0.50x confidence may still generate occasional false signals (30% WR)

SPY.pit_verdict: HOLD — Confidence penalized to 0.80x (33% WR, but 4.74 PF keeps it in universe)
SPY.accuracy: 33.3% WR (3 trades), but 10.50% avg win vs -1.11% avg loss
SPY.notes: SPY underperforms on WR but has large wins. Kept for tail-gain capture at 0.80x confidence.
SPY.pattern: Bull regime. Wait for F&G < 15 (extreme panic).

QQQ.pit_verdict: HOLD — Boosted to 1.10x (67% WR, 100% short-hold WR)
QQQ.notes: QQQ is reliable on short holds. Medium holds (6-15d) have 0% WR. V10.2 shortened horizon to 5d.

XLK.pit_verdict: STAR — Boosted to 1.25x (100% WR, infinite PF, Sharpe 16.68)
XLK.notes: Best tech asset. All wins in panic conditions (F&G 0-10). Short holds dominate.

XLV.notes: Healthcare defensive play. Works in both panic AND greed conditions (unusual).

XLU.pit_verdict: STAR — Boosted to 1.30x (100% WR, Sharpe 122.81 — BEST in universe)
XLU.notes: Highest Sharpe in entire universe. Panic entries only (F&G 0-10). Zero stop-hits.

INDA.notes: Second-highest Sharpe. India ETF benefits from diversification + panic buying.

EFA.pit_verdict: STAR — Boosted to 1.30x (100% WR, 7.72% avg return)
EFA.notes: Highest single-trade return in universe. International priority active.

EEM.notes: EM outperforms on panic entries. Zero stop-hits, 100% target-hit.

GLD.pit_verdict: STRONG — Boosted to 1.20x (75% WR, best commodity)
GLD.notes: Gold benefits from fear. V10.2 extended hold to 15d (medium 100% WR, 4.15% avg).

XLE.pit_verdict: WEAK — Penalized to 0.50x (30% WR, -9.21 Sharpe, 80% stop-hit)
XLE.notes: Worst asset in universe. MRE contrarian strategy fundamentally doesn't work for energy.

FXI.pit_verdict: WEAK — Penalized to 0.60x (50% WR but -1.40 Sharpe)
FXI.notes: China ETF is noisy. Only medium holds and panic F&G entries are profitable.

TLT.notes: V10.2 shortened hold from 20d to 5d. Short holds profitable, long holds not.

XLF.pit_verdict: HOLD — Slight penalty 0.90x (50% WR, medium holds only)
XLF.notes: XLF needs medium holds (100% WR) — short holds have 0% WR. V10.2 adjusted horizon.

VNQ.pit_verdict: HOLD — Penalized to 0.80x (50% WR, medium holds optimal)
VNQ.notes: REITs need patience. Medium holds 100% WR (3.15% avg), long holds 0%.

HYG.pit_verdict: CAUTIOUS BUY — Boosted to 1.15x (100% WR, 1 trade only)
HYG.notes: High-yield credit. Only 1 trade in backtest — promising but insufficient data.

GDX.accuracy: 46.2% WR (13 trades), highest trade count in universe
GDX.notes: Gold miners are noisy. Short holds are only profitable window. Panic entries best.

BITO.pit_verdict: HOLD — Slight boost 1.05x (75% WR but volatile)
BITO.notes: Bitcoin proxy works on fear entries (F&G 10-20 extreme fear has 100% WR). Short holds only.

IWM.notes: Small caps have high stop-hit rate. Only panic entries (F&G 0-10) profitable.

XLC.notes: Communications tracks tech closely. Short holds 100% WR.

XLP.notes: Defensive consumer staples. Short holds 100% WR. Panic entries strongest.

EWJ.notes: Japan ETF solid on panic entries. 50% stop-hit but still 100% WR = recovers from dips.

XLB.notes: Materials need medium holds. Short holds have 0% WR — V10.2 extended horizon to 10d.

DBA.pit_verdict: HOLD — Penalized to 0.80x (50% WR, medium holds needed)
DBA.notes: Agriculture. Medium holds 100% WR (3.57%), short holds 0%. V10.2 adjusted horizon.

SLV.reason: 33% WR, -4.54 Sharpe, -1.10% avg return, 66.7% stop-hit rate. Negative expectancy.

IEF.reason: 0% WR (worst in universe), -17.68 Sharpe, -0.70% avg return. No profitable scenario.
